column2: Ballymun Jobs Centre and Department of Social Protection	121	On Senator O'Donnell's point
column3: we have spoken a good deal on JobBridge but regarding the positive outcomes of the Youth Guarantee pilot in Ballymun and the 29% drop
column4: the most startling statistic is that in an era when youth unemployment generally is reducing
column5: to have a rise in youth unemployment shows that without that concerted effort there are young people today who could be in training or in work experience.

column1: #MarieLouiseODonnell	unknown-#MarieLouiseODonnell-party	unknown-#MarieLouiseODonnell-dob	unknown-#MarieLouiseODonnell-constituency	speech	unkown-language	2015-11-04 00:00:00	JobBridge and the Youth Guarantee: National Youth Council
column2: Ballymun Jobs Centre and Department of Social Protection	122	A continued concerted effort.

column1: #	unknown-#-party	unknown-#-dob	unknown-#-constituency	speech	unkown-language	2015-11-04 00:00:00	JobBridge and the Youth Guarantee: National Youth Council
column2: Ballymun Jobs Centre and Department of Social Protection	123	Yes. I will make a few points in response to the comments made. With regard to our study
column3: which Deputy Ryan mentioned as well
column4: as a youth council the issue of JobBridge had arisen frequently and as Mr. Carroll said
column5: there is a lot of anecdotal evidence but that is of little use. We wanted to do a study but we had limited resources. We could have approached the Department for funding but
column6: first
column7: it might not have given it to us and
column8: second
column9: it might be perceived as not being independent. It is important to state that while 84 young people responded
column10: seven of whom I met in a structured one-to-one interview
column11: and the details of the methodology is contained in the full report
column12: the issue was to try to get a snapshot because we wanted to get some evidence to bring to Mr. Carroll
column13: his colleagues and others who are working in the area. Mr. Carroll put it correctly. The Indecon report is an excellent report. I have no queries about it but was it of its time? Indecon also mentions in its report that 72% of the people who were on JobBridge at that time and who participated in its survey had previous work experience. These were people who were primarily victims of the recession. That probably reflects the fact that young people have found it more difficult because many young people were coming out of education and training without work experience.  I would also make the point that self-selection might be part of the reason for the difference
column14: as Deputy Ryan said. Some questions were raised about our study being self-selecting but
column16: the study Indecon did regarding their much larger numbers was also self-selecting because people were asked to participate and some people responded. Some did not
column18: and it is important to put on the record that we accept that our report is small-scale. We just did not have the resources to do a big one. I met with young people who had very good experiences but there were problems. Many young people were willing to put up with things for the six to nine months because they knew if they complained they may not get the reference to move on. That is the reality. Many people keep their heads down. The cooling off period was mentioned by Senator Craughwell. As Mr. Carroll said
column19: one is not allowed to recruit a new person to the same position for six months. Some of the people I met were very clear that there was abuse of that because some host organisations were changing the title of a position and were able to get around the six month period. It was not widespread but it was happening. I just wanted to make those final comments.

column1: #	unknown-#-party	unknown-#-dob	unknown-#-constituency	speech	unkown-language	2015-11-04 00:00:00	JobBridge and the Youth Guarantee: National Youth Council
column2: Ballymun Jobs Centre and Department of Social Protection	124	I must state that I have no absolute evidence that the increase in the numbers signing on in Ballymun in terms of the under 25s is a direct cause of the end of the pilot
column3: but all I would say is that it is a fact. On the pilot
column4: we reorganised the local employment services
column5: LES. We were asked to do that by the Department as part of the implementation of the pilot. We allocated five guidance officers to work on the Youth Guarantee. That reduced the ratio of unemployed person to guidance officer. That enabled them to spend more time with the unemployed person to work out the plan and then support him or her to implement that plan. At the end of the pilot we reorganised the service again and
column6: again
column7: the numbers overall coming into the service increased as part of the contract. The ratio went up. We would like to try to reduce that ratio further. That would allow us to spend more time working with the client to make sure they are embedded in their career plan and that they are supported to progress.

column1: #MarieLouiseODonnell	unknown-#MarieLouiseODonnell-party	unknown-#MarieLouiseODonnell-dob	unknown-#MarieLouiseODonnell-constituency	speech	unkown-language	2015-11-04 00:00:00	JobBridge and the Youth Guarantee: National Youth Council
column2: Ballymun Jobs Centre and Department of Social Protection	125	What does Mr. Creedon need to do that? Is it money?

column1: #	unknown-#-party	unknown-#-dob	unknown-#-constituency	speech	unkown-language	2015-11-04 00:00:00	JobBridge and the Youth Guarantee: National Youth Council
column2: Ballymun Jobs Centre and Department of Social Protection	126	Not necessarily. What we would need to do is reduce the ratio. That means we might not be able to deal with as many clients in a particular year as we would have previously. Currently
column3: 60 new clients a week are being referred by the Department. If that was reduced to
column4: say
column6: we could spend more time with that 40.

column1: #JoannaTuffy	unknown-#JoannaTuffy-party	unknown-#JoannaTuffy-dob	unknown-#JoannaTuffy-constituency	speech	unkown-language	2015-11-04 00:00:00	JobBridge and the Youth Guarantee: National Youth Council
column2: Ballymun Jobs Centre and Department of Social Protection	127	What about more staff? Would that be the way to do it?

column1: #	unknown-#-party	unknown-#-dob	unknown-#-constituency	speech	unkown-language	2015-11-04 00:00:00	JobBridge and the Youth Guarantee: National Youth Council
column2: Ballymun Jobs Centre and Department of Social Protection	128	I think we could manage it without more staff because not everybody requires the same degree of intensity.

column1: #MarieLouiseODonnell	unknown-#MarieLouiseODonnell-party	unknown-#MarieLouiseODonnell-dob	unknown-#MarieLouiseODonnell-constituency	speech	unkown-language	2015-11-04 00:00:00	JobBridge and the Youth Guarantee: National Youth Council
column2: Ballymun Jobs Centre and Department of Social Protection	129	Has the reorganisation that took place since the pilot finished not allowed Mr. Creedon to do that?

column1: #	unknown-#-party	unknown-#-dob	unknown-#-constituency	speech	unkown-language	2015-11-04 00:00:00	JobBridge and the Youth Guarantee: National Youth Council
column2: Ballymun Jobs Centre and Department of Social Protection	130	Exactly
column3: yes. We would have fewer guidance people working directly with the young people now.

column1: #JoannaTuffy	unknown-#JoannaTuffy-party	unknown-#JoannaTuffy-dob	unknown-#JoannaTuffy-constituency	speech	unkown-language	2015-11-04 00:00:00	JobBridge and the Youth Guarantee: National Youth Council
column2: Ballymun Jobs Centre and Department of Social Protection	131	Is the centre a victim of its own success?

column1: #	unknown-#-party	unknown-#-dob	unknown-#-constituency	speech	unkown-language	2015-11-04 00:00:00	JobBridge and the Youth Guarantee: National Youth Council
column2: Ballymun Jobs Centre and Department of Social Protection	132	Maybe
column3: but it is not just that ratio issue. It was because other things were done during the pilot. For example
column4: they changed the eligibility for the community employment
column5: CE
column6: schemes purely for people coming through the pilot. They reduced the age to 20
column7: I believe
column8: and that was hugely successful because it enabled young people to access CE schemes that they were denied previously. That has ended again
column9: so that option is not available. They did the same with the Tús programme. Through the pilot there was also a flexible fund which allowed us to support people to access PLC programmes. Before we took any of the intake into the pilot the agencies worked together to come up with a local plan as to how it would all work
column10: and it was not a case of one size fits all. We did an analysis of the young people in the area in terms of their education levels
column11: experiences and the barriers they faced. We then tried to offer specific options to those three target groups. It is a combination of all of those
column12: namely
column14: the links we had developed and built with the youth services
column15: the education and training services and the employers and our capacity to try out new things . All of that combined-----

column1: #MarieLouiseODonnell	unknown-#MarieLouiseODonnell-party	unknown-#MarieLouiseODonnell-dob	unknown-#MarieLouiseODonnell-constituency	speech	unkown-language	2015-11-04 00:00:00	JobBridge and the Youth Guarantee: National Youth Council
column2: Ballymun Jobs Centre and Department of Social Protection	133	Would Mr. Creedon come back to that but not call it a pilot?

column1: #	unknown-#-party	unknown-#-dob	unknown-#-constituency	speech	unkown-language	2015-11-04 00:00:00	JobBridge and the Youth Guarantee: National Youth Council
column2: Ballymun Jobs Centre and Department of Social Protection	134	Yes. If we could do that-----

column1: #MarieLouiseODonnell	unknown-#MarieLouiseODonnell-party	unknown-#MarieLouiseODonnell-dob	unknown-#MarieLouiseODonnell-constituency	speech	unkown-language	2015-11-04 00:00:00	JobBridge and the Youth Guarantee: National Youth Council
column2: Ballymun Jobs Centre and Department of Social Protection	135	Why can he not do it?

column1: #	unknown-#-party	unknown-#-dob	unknown-#-constituency	speech	unkown-language	2015-11-04 00:00:00	JobBridge and the Youth Guarantee: National Youth Council
column2: Ballymun Jobs Centre and Department of Social Protection	136	It is not up to me to answer that.

column1: #MarieLouiseODonnell	unknown-#MarieLouiseODonnell-party	unknown-#MarieLouiseODonnell-dob	unknown-#MarieLouiseODonnell-constituency	speech	unkown-language	2015-11-04 00:00:00	JobBridge and the Youth Guarantee: National Youth Council
column2: Ballymun Jobs Centre and Department of Social Protection	137	Is that not a case that could be well made?

column1: #	unknown-#-party	unknown-#-dob	unknown-#-constituency	speech	unkown-language	2015-11-04 00:00:00	JobBridge and the Youth Guarantee: National Youth Council
column2: Ballymun Jobs Centre and Department of Social Protection	138	Indeed. The valuation reports make that case very well.

column1: #JoannaTuffy	unknown-#JoannaTuffy-party	unknown-#JoannaTuffy-dob	unknown-#JoannaTuffy-constituency	speech	unkown-language	2015-11-04 00:00:00	JobBridge and the Youth Guarantee: National Youth Council
column2: Ballymun Jobs Centre and Department of Social Protection	139	Who decides?

column1: #MarieLouiseODonnell	unknown-#MarieLouiseODonnell-party	unknown-#MarieLouiseODonnell-dob	unknown-#MarieLouiseODonnell-constituency	speech	unkown-language	2015-11-04 00:00:00	JobBridge and the Youth Guarantee: National Youth Council
column2: Ballymun Jobs Centre and Department of Social Protection	140	Who decides?

column1: #	unknown-#-party	unknown-#-dob	unknown-#-constituency	speech	unkown-language	2015-11-04 00:00:00	JobBridge and the Youth Guarantee: National Youth Council
column2: Ballymun Jobs Centre and Department of Social Protection	141	The Department or whoever; I do not know. We have a contract to implement the LES in the area so we just implement whatever the contract asks us to do.

column1: #JoannaTuffy	unknown-#JoannaTuffy-party	unknown-#JoannaTuffy-dob	unknown-#JoannaTuffy-constituency	speech	unkown-language	2015-11-04 00:00:00	JobBridge and the Youth Guarantee: National Youth Council
column2: Ballymun Jobs Centre and Department of Social Protection	142	We should conclude soon.

column1: #	unknown-#-party	unknown-#-dob	unknown-#-constituency	speech	unkown-language	2015-11-04 00:00:00	JobBridge and the Youth Guarantee: National Youth Council
column2: Ballymun Jobs Centre and Department of Social Protection	143	Can I make some other suggestions?

column1: #JoannaTuffy	unknown-#JoannaTuffy-party	unknown-#JoannaTuffy-dob	unknown-#JoannaTuffy-constituency	speech	unkown-language	2015-11-04 00:00:00	JobBridge and the Youth Guarantee: National Youth Council
column2: Ballymun Jobs Centre and Department of Social Protection	144	Yes.

column1: #	unknown-#-party	unknown-#-dob	unknown-#-constituency	speech	unkown-language	2015-11-04 00:00:00	JobBridge and the Youth Guarantee: National Youth Council
column2: Ballymun Jobs Centre and Department of Social Protection	145	We have made that suggestion in our submission. In a European context we are often very good at running pilots but we are not very good at translating the lessons of the pilots into the mainstream.

column1: #MarieLouiseODonnell	unknown-#MarieLouiseODonnell-party	unknown-#MarieLouiseODonnell-dob	unknown-#MarieLouiseODonnell-constituency	speech	unkown-language	2015-11-04 00:00:00	JobBridge and the Youth Guarantee: National Youth Council
column2: Ballymun Jobs Centre and Department of Social Protection	146	It is a question of translating them into actuality in the long term.

column1: #	unknown-#-party	unknown-#-dob	unknown-#-constituency	speech	unkown-language	2015-11-04 00:00:00	JobBridge and the Youth Guarantee: National Youth Council
column2: Ballymun Jobs Centre and Department of Social Protection	147	However
column3: I imagine that is on the basis of implementing the pilot elsewhere in exactly the way it was run. First
column4: there is no need to do that. Second
column5: I imagine we would need to run it in another area or run it in several areas. In other words
column6: we could upscale the work done on the pilot to another area to see how it would work there
column7: for example
column8: in a bigger area or whatever. These are simple steps which could be taken.

column1: #MarieLouiseODonnell	unknown-#MarieLouiseODonnell-party	unknown-#MarieLouiseODonnell-dob	unknown-#MarieLouiseODonnell-constituency	speech	unkown-language	2015-11-04 00:00:00	JobBridge and the Youth Guarantee: National Youth Council
column2: Ballymun Jobs Centre and Department of Social Protection	148	Has the Ballymun Job Centre had an answer to these suggestions and evaluations on the part of the Department? Did Mr. Creedon present them?

column1: #	unknown-#-party	unknown-#-dob	unknown-#-constituency	speech	unkown-language	2015-11-04 00:00:00	JobBridge and the Youth Guarantee: National Youth Council
column2: Ballymun Jobs Centre and Department of Social Protection	149	They were all presented at the final conference.

column1: #MarieLouiseODonnell	unknown-#MarieLouiseODonnell-party	unknown-#MarieLouiseODonnell-dob	unknown-#MarieLouiseODonnell-constituency	speech	unkown-language	2015-11-04 00:00:00	JobBridge and the Youth Guarantee: National Youth Council
column2: Ballymun Jobs Centre and Department of Social Protection	150	Has Mr. Creedon had an answer to what he has presented?

column1: #	unknown-#-party	unknown-#-dob	unknown-#-constituency	speech	unkown-language	2015-11-04 00:00:00	JobBridge and the Youth Guarantee: National Youth Council
column2: Ballymun Jobs Centre and Department of Social Protection	151	No.

column1: #MarieLouiseODonnell	unknown-#MarieLouiseODonnell-party	unknown-#MarieLouiseODonnell-dob	unknown-#MarieLouiseODonnell-constituency	speech	unkown-language	2015-11-04 00:00:00	JobBridge and the Youth Guarantee: National Youth Council
column2: Ballymun Jobs Centre and Department of Social Protection	152	I think that is important.

column1: #JoannaTuffy	unknown-#JoannaTuffy-party	unknown-#JoannaTuffy-dob	unknown-#JoannaTuffy-constituency	speech	unkown-language	2015-11-04 00:00:00	JobBridge and the Youth Guarantee: National Youth Council
column2: Ballymun Jobs Centre and Department of Social Protection	153	We can raise that. Do you have any information
column3: Mr. Corcoran?

column1: #	unknown-#-party	unknown-#-dob	unknown-#-constituency	speech	unkown-language	2015-11-04 00:00:00	JobBridge and the Youth Guarantee: National Youth Council
column2: Ballymun Jobs Centre and Department of Social Protection	154	I will make a general point about the Youth Guarantee and whether there is a strategy and so on. The policies being followed aim towards the most important objective
column3: which is to get people back into jobs. That is the largest single element of the Government's policies in this area. Obviously
column4: there is a good deal of evidence
column5: with falling unemployment and rising employment
column6: that this part of the plan is working. The other element of the guarantee implementation plan was the issue of substantial engagement with the newly-unemployed young jobseekers. The resources for that are being delivered in part by the use of local employment services. Increasingly
column7: they are being delivered by the movement to JobPath
column8: which is releasing resources inside the Department to undertake more detailed engagement with young jobseekers at the beginning of their unemployment spell. That was done in this case as well. What happened in terms of unemployment in Ballymun? It is important to note that it is unlike the overall process planned for the Youth Guarantee relating to engaging with newly-unemployed young people. Given the scale of the resources deployed in Ballymun
column9: every young person on the live register
column10: regardless of duration
column11: was approached during a brief period. This was done comprehensively in a way that could not be done nationally - the resources simply would not be available. That was part of the impact. While unemployment may have risen a little during this year for young people in Ballymun
column12: there are seasonal elements at play. Unemployment is still down year on year in Ballymun. It is down by 9% on the same period last year. It is not down by as much as it was at the turn of the year
column15: that is to do with the fact that we had a major engagement with all young people on the live register and a significant programme provision was made. Those people cannot stay on programmes forever. We cannot go on repeating those processes with the same people over and over. The return of people to the register from those programmes is part of the reason it has not been declining as rapidly as before compared to the rest of the country.

column1: #MarieLouiseODonnell	unknown-#MarieLouiseODonnell-party	unknown-#MarieLouiseODonnell-dob	unknown-#MarieLouiseODonnell-constituency	speech	unkown-language	2015-11-04 00:00:00	JobBridge and the Youth Guarantee: National Youth Council
column2: Ballymun Jobs Centre and Department of Social Protection	155	It is also partly that
column3: as people point out to us all the time
column4: we are not really operating the Nordic model. Mr. Creedon has a very good point. Pilots are very good. It is a very good and wonderful use of resources. Creativity
column5: action
column6: outreach and tangents were put into it. Now it has come to an end. Did Mr. Creedon not make a good point? We need to take those tangents and all the learning and bring them somewhere else. We need to bring them throughout the country as well as all the other things we are doing. When we stop these initiatives there is a reversion to type. I take the points Mr. Corcoran has made. However
column7: if we are seeing a rise again
column8: even with the economy turning around
column9: then perhaps we should be more definite about how we implement what Mr. Creedon is suggesting. I saw him look aghast at one of the things Mr. Corcoran said. He was not looking aghast at Mr. Corcoran as such; he looked off into the distance.

column1: #	unknown-#-party	unknown-#-dob	unknown-#-constituency	speech	unkown-language	2015-11-04 00:00:00	JobBridge and the Youth Guarantee: National Youth Council
column2: Ballymun Jobs Centre and Department of Social Protection	156	I am keen to make some points. Not every area needs that sort of intensity of support.

column1: #MarieLouiseODonnell	unknown-#MarieLouiseODonnell-party	unknown-#MarieLouiseODonnell-dob	unknown-#MarieLouiseODonnell-constituency	speech	unkown-language	2015-11-04 00:00:00	JobBridge and the Youth Guarantee: National Youth Council
column2: Ballymun Jobs Centre and Department of Social Protection	157	That is true.

column1: #	unknown-#-party	unknown-#-dob	unknown-#-constituency	speech	unkown-language	2015-11-04 00:00:00	JobBridge and the Youth Guarantee: National Youth Council
column2: Ballymun Jobs Centre and Department of Social Protection	158	Not every individual would need it either. Within the labour market there tends to be a relationship between housing policy
column3: where we house people and labour market outcomes and chances. We end up with concentrations of unemployment
column4: disadvantage and poverty within areas. There is certainly a strong argument to the effect that the type of intervention we need in those areas is different from the type of intervention we would need elsewhere. The pilot proved that. It was operated within a very disadvantaged area where there were significant concentrations of unemployment and disadvantage as well as various combinations of barriers to the labour market. It is not a question of rolling out that intensive support everywhere.

column1: #MarieLouiseODonnell	unknown-#MarieLouiseODonnell-party	unknown-#MarieLouiseODonnell-dob	unknown-#MarieLouiseODonnell-constituency	speech	unkown-language	2015-11-04 00:00:00	JobBridge and the Youth Guarantee: National Youth Council
column2: Ballymun Jobs Centre and Department of Social Protection	159	We can pick targets.

column1: #	unknown-#-party	unknown-#-dob	unknown-#-constituency	speech	unkown-language	2015-11-04 00:00:00	JobBridge and the Youth Guarantee: National Youth Council
column2: Ballymun Jobs Centre and Department of Social Protection	160	We can target it and
column3: therefore
column4: there is not as much pressure on resources. It is a question of thinking about it differently. I can remember - I was around at the time - when they had the task force on long-term unemployment which set up the local employment services. The local employment services were deliberately set up in particular areas of disadvantage to bring all the actors together. They have developed that expertise. They are generally located in specific areas of disadvantage. We do not need to have it as a national scheme. We have to consider what we need in a given area. For example
column5: we would have to run something very different from the pilot in Ballymun in a rural area. It is about looking at enabling national programmes to have some local flexibility. That is a key lesson for me.

column1: #JoannaTuffy	unknown-#JoannaTuffy-party	unknown-#JoannaTuffy-dob	unknown-#JoannaTuffy-constituency	speech	unkown-language	2015-11-04 00:00:00	JobBridge and the Youth Guarantee: National Youth Council
column2: Ballymun Jobs Centre and Department of Social Protection	161	We have to be out of the room by 3.40 p.m. so we only have four minutes. Is there anything outstanding? Does anyone have anything else to say?

column1: #	unknown-#-party	unknown-#-dob	unknown-#-constituency	speech	unkown-language	2015-11-04 00:00:00	JobBridge and the Youth Guarantee: National Youth Council
column2: Ballymun Jobs Centre and Department of Social Protection	162	In general
column3: we must have interventions to create a different type of intervention. Certainly
column4: while it should not be the same everywhere
column5: we need the roll-out of these guarantee schemes nationally
column6: with a focus on particular areas that need it. We certainly need it to be rolled out nationally because it is not happening at the moment.

column1: #JoannaTuffy	unknown-#JoannaTuffy-party	unknown-#JoannaTuffy-dob	unknown-#JoannaTuffy-constituency	speech	unkown-language	2015-11-04 00:00:00	JobBridge and the Youth Guarantee: National Youth Council
column2: Ballymun Jobs Centre and Department of Social Protection	163	I think we have had a very good discussion
column3: probably one of the best debates we have ever had on the topic. I am going to call the meeting to a close. I thank all our guests from the National Youth Council of Ireland
column4: Ballymun Job Centre and the Department of Social Protection. Obviously
column5: we will revisit the issue. Senator O'Donnell and Deputy Ryan have done a good deal of work on this issue
column6: as have other members of the committee. I expect this is only one of many meetings we will have on the matter.
